results.title: Big yellow taxi
results.creator_credit: John Wilson and Fine Art Productions
results.brief_description: Joni Mitchell sings to an animated interpretation of her lyrics in this film with a clear environmental warning. Adam and Eve’s paradise is invaded by powerful road-making machinery that proceeds to tear down the vegetation and cover the earth with tar and cement.

results.title: Big Wednesday
results.creator_credit: John Milius, Buzz Feitshans and A-Team Productions
results.brief_description: Set between 1962 and 1974, “Big Wednesday” is the story of three surfing friends - Matt, Jack and Leroy. We see their loves, fights and the hero worship that follows them as they conquer the waves. The South Swell 1962: the three rule the waves. Together with their friends they get drunk, go on surfing holidays and have wild and destructive parties. As the years pass, the Vietnam War and growing up take their toll. They witness the changes in themselves, their home and friends. The Great Swell 1974: Matt, Jack and Leroy re-unite to brave one last journey together, to surf the great swell. “Big Wednesday” encapsulates the emotions of passing youth against the splendour of the sea and surfing. Includes a special appearance by surfing legend, “Mr. Pipeline”, Jerry Lopez. Cast includes: William Katt, Gary Busey, Jan Michael Vincent, Patti D’Arbanville and Lee Purcell.

results.title: Big town (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claudia Weill, Eliot Noyes, Michael Bortman and Cyclops Films
results.brief_description: Presents five vignettes about life in and around New York City. “Mannequin” - by Michael Bortman - preparation for a mannequin parade. “Marriage” - a city marriage; “Commuters” - early morning commuters; “Yoga” - a yoga group; “Lost and Found” - the little losses that loom large to the people of the big city - by Elliot Noyes, Jr and Claudia Weill.

results.title: Big people, little people
results.brief_description: A big city is inhabited only by Little People (children) who do all the things Big People usually do - as policemen, train drivers, postmen, builders, housewives - but this leaves the play-grounds empty. However, the mayor is wise and sends for some Big People to take over the work of the city.

results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.

results.title: Big nose: Takeshi Hoshino with the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept of puppetry as an art form as it goes backstage at the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre. Takeshi Hoshino, art director from Japan’s Puk Theatre designs and directs the production of “Big Nose”, a traditional Japanese story. Suitable for years prep-6 and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Big night out
results.brief_description: Wilbur Wilde and Kerry Simpson feature in this rap cartoon addressing the importance of not sharing needles and how to correctly clean them. Using animated and studio footage the story revolves around a party where the issue of safe needle use arises. “Big Night Out” provides safe use messages (ie: cleaning injecting equipment effectively and where to get new needles and syringes) via the Streetwise cartoon character, Dr Klevadik. The language utilised within the video is “street based” in order to increase target group acceptance. Aims to provide safe messages regarding intravenous drug use and potential HIV and HepB transmission.

results.title: Big night
results.creator_credit: Stanley Tucci, Campbell Scott, Jonathan Filley, Rysher Entertainment and Timpano Productions
results.brief_description: A treat for movie and food lovers everywhere, this multi-award winning comedy tells the story of two Italian brothers (Primo and Secondo), whose superb restaurant is on the brink of bankruptcy. Their only chance is to risk everything they own on one big night where they invite local identities and band leader Louis Prima to a six course, twenty-two dish feast that will either make or break them. Cast includes Ian Holm, Tony Shalhoub, Stanley Tucci, Isabella Rossellini and Minnie Driver.

results.title: Big military parade = Da yue bing
results.brief_description: Four hundred volunteers, many of them fresh recruits still in their teens come to a training camp for eight months of intensive drilling. The film focuses on four of the young squaddies and two of the officers, looking at the ways they bond and split apart, but also at their most intimate feelings: their sense of physical inadequacy, for instance, or their hypocrisy in presenting an exterior they know to be false. It’s surprisingly humane and moving. There are images here whose power and grace burn themselves into the mind. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
